DataElement.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Biopsy Pathological Staging Positive Finding Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of method used to pathologically confirm axillary nodal involvement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Biopsy Pathological Staging Positive Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an axillary lymph node biopsy (removal of tissue or fluid with a needle from an axillary lymph node) and a positive finding (the observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease) in pathological staging (an examination that is performed to determine the extent of the spread of cancer based on histopathologic examination).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Lymph Node Biopsy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle. :A test in which a lymph node or a piece of a lymph node is removed for examination under a microscope for signs of infection or disease such as cancer.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.
A test in which a lymph node or a piece of a lymph node is removed for examination under a microscope for signs of infection or disease such as cancer.

Property.preferredDefinition: An examination that is performed to determine the extent of the spread of cancer based on histopathologic examination of one or more pathology specimens.  Pathologic staging uses evidence acquired during the process of clinical staging, supplemented by histopathologic examination of surgical specimens.:An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

Concepts.definition: An examination that is performed to determine the extent of the spread of cancer based on histopathologic examination of one or more pathology specimens. Pathologic staging uses evidence acquired during the process of clinical staging, supplemented by histopathologic examination of surgical specimens.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of method used to confirm pathological staging and involvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
